importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date of the article's publication, marking the conclusion of the ALCS and the Blue Jays' advancement to the World Series.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame covers the ALCS, culminating in Game 7 on October 21, 2025, which determined the American League champion and the path to the World Series.

keyTakeAways: George Springer's three-run home run in the seventh inning of Game 7 turned the tide for the Toronto Blue Jays, securing their victory over the Seattle Mariners.
The Blue Jays advance to their first World Series since 1993, setting up a high-stakes matchup against the defending champions, the Los Angeles Dodgers.
The game featured controversy over a groundball play involving Ernie Clement and Josh Naylor, where replays showed Naylor’s helmet deflecting the ball, leading to a call for obstruction.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. is named ALCS MVP for his outstanding performance, including a .385 batting average and three home runs in the series.
The Seattle Mariners remain the only MLB franchise never to have appeared in a World Series, adding to the historical significance of their elimination.
George Springer, despite being injured in Game 5, returned for Games 6 and 7 and played a pivotal role in the team's victory, emphasizing his commitment to the team and fans.
Chris Bassitt and Jeff Hoffman closed the game effectively, with Hoffman pitching a perfect ninth inning to seal the win.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in a dramatic Game 7 of the American League Championship Series, advancing to their first World Series since 1993. The game featured a pivotal three-run home run by George Springer in the seventh inning, which turned the momentum in Toronto’s favor after the Mariners had taken an early lead. Controversy arose during the first inning when a groundball play involving Josh Naylor and Ernie Clement led to a disputed call, with replays showing the ball ricocheting off Naylor’s helmet. Despite earlier setbacks and injuries to Springer, who was hit in the knee during Game 5, he returned and delivered the decisive hit. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP with a .385 batting average and three home runs. The Blue Jays will now host the defending champions, the Los Angeles Dodgers, in the World Series, while the Mariners remain the only MLB franchise to never appear in a World Series.
title: George Springer’s epic home run helps send the Toronto Blue Jays to the World Series with ALCS Game 7 win over Seattle
